alert.note: Alert for Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 24 at 8:25PM AKDT until March 27 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected Friday into Saturday. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Until midnight Saturday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Conditions have improved this evening as winds have decreased to 25 to 35 mph, and it is expected that visibility will remain above one mile tonight. Winds will increase again on Friday, with visibility falling through the day. Blizzard conditions will develop again by noon Friday and last into Saturday. Winds gusting to 50 mph will cause whiteout conditions in blowing snow from Friday afternoon through Saturday. Significant drifting of the snow is likely. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
